title.narrative: CHILD-FOCUSED INVESTMENTS

description.narrative: Child-focused investments are bolstered by strong and equitable national plans and budgets, legislative scrutiny and advocacy., which contributes to Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Children In Urban Settings / Local Governance, Corporate External Relations And Partnerships, Communication And Resource Mobilization, Economic And Social Policy General, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas, Policy Advocacy â€“ Urban, Civil Society, Parliament, Environment, Public Finance And Local Governance, Social Protection, Social Protection And Child Poverty. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: SPPIM - : Evidence based advocacy and innovative partnership build the investment case for children

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Child-focused investments are bolstered by strong and equitable national plans and budgets, legislative scrutiny and advocacy.

description.narrative: UNICEF work in public finance for children (PF4C) contributed to achieve concrete and significant gains in protecting public investment for children, despite a severe financial and economic crisis. Financial transparency and oversight of Ministry of Finance, Parliament was strengthened, thanks to a coordinated evidence based advocacy for Child-focused investments. | Status:Met | As-of Date:19/01/2017

title.narrative: Number of annual State Budget Proposals in the CP cycle that civil society and Parliament review together
